fields.profile: Matthew Blaisse, born in 1985, is a graduate of Lebanon Valley College near Hershey, PA where he received a B.A. in Music, concentrating in piano, as well as a B.S. in Physics.  He lives in nearby Harrisburg where he serves as organist and choir director at Good Shepherd Lutheran Church and teaches piano at the State Street Academy of Music, both in Harrisburg.  He also works as a freelance pianist/keyboardist and operates an independent business as a piano tuner and technician, all while continuing graduate studies through the Pennsylvania State University, pursuing a M.Eng. in Accoustics.

Composer and conductor Federico Garcia, born in Bogotá (Colombia), based in Pittsburgh since 2001, is Artistic Director of ALIA MUSICA Pittsburgh since its foundation in 2006. He is a lecturer at the music program of Chatham University, and teaches private lessons in piano, composition, and music theory. His music is atonal but not entirely abstract, and he strives to engage the listener in a joint exploration and discovery of new possibilities, new relationships between sounds. Some of his pieces have received mentions and awards, including first prize in the 5th National Composition Prize in Bogotá in 2001 (for Passacaglia on a theme by Bach). Website

Born in 1986, Matthew Scott studied composition at Colorado State University under Dr. Forest Greenough, Dr. David Wohl, and Dr. James David, working also within a student-run group, the New Music Forum. While at CSU, he was president of the Student Composers Alliance. While his focus is primarily on choral music and the unique sonorities capable within a choir, he also writes for piano and small mixed ensembles. Matthew works as the founder and president of Matthew J. Scott Music Publishing, a company striving to bring new and less well-known composers into the spotlight. Website

In 2006, after graduating high school, Brett Yacuta spent the first year in college at Palm Beach Atlantic University in West Palm Beach, FL. Where he learned to hone his skills to fill up both a sound of an orchestration and the page it's self.  He became involved in a city-wide multimedia production called "Gethsemane," which portrayed the stages of Christ's crucifixion in a very contemporary way. This production involved composed music from the rock, classical, and contemporary styles (sometimes all at the same time), it involved computer music, psycho-acoustics, audience participation, video production (mostly improvised video direction), spoken word, live and recorded performance of music, theater and dance. The show was a success: The Palm Beach Sentinel actually heralded the production as "...both eye opening and mystifying. One of PBA's best!!"

He also studied at Colorado State University as a Music Performance concentration and at the Lamont School of Music, at the University of Denver, as a Music Composition / Film Music Bachelors. After which, He plan on moving to New York to begin pursuing his compositional career.

Born in Greece in 1977, Panayiotis Demopoulos grew up in the provincial northern town of Kozani. Raised in a musically enthusiastic family (his four elder siblings are all musicians) he took music lessons at the age of 5 with P. Kourou at the piano and P. Papistas at the violin and gave his first public performance at the Parnassus Hall, Athens, in 1984. He attained a BMus at the Ian Tomlin School of Music, Napier University, as well as an MMus and a postgraduate diploma in piano performance at the Royal Northern College of Music. Mr. Demopoulos’s music has been commissioned and performed by amongst others the Britten Sinfonia, Sarah Nicholls, Harry Spaarnay, the Birtwistle Resonances Festival, Tui Clark, the Chimera Ensemble, the Thessaloniki State Conservatoire, Ensemble New York, Angelica Cathariou, the Quintessensis quintet, the Cambridge Gamelan, CUMIS, the Megaron new music workshops and the Anaeresis Ensemble. His works have been heard in Italy, Finland, the Czech Republic, Poland, Switzerland, the U.K. and Greece and his music is published by Anaeresis and recorded by Dunelm Records. Styx for solo flute was the set work in the 2000 Woodwind competition in Thessaloniki. In 2001 Panos won the Edinburgh International Festival Association competition in composition with Tetractys for solo piano and in 2003 he won the Britten Sinfonia competition with Music for a finer vesper which was consequently scheduled for a broadcast by the BBC. Website

fields.long_desc: I live my life in widening circles was originally completed for the "Outside the Bachs 2008" competition, presented by the First United Methodist Church in Fort Worth, TX. The text, based on a short work by Rainer Maria Rilke, suggests a broad, circular movement throughout the score. Combined with a unique rhythmic motif and a rich harmonic language, Matthew Scott's composition both challenges and pleases the singers and the audience. Audio Sample: Score Sample: Requires Adobe Reader:
fields.name: I live my life in widening circles
fields.tags: a cappella, piano reduction, 2007, moderato, audio sample, score sample
fields.short_desc: A simple choral piece leveraging the imagery of R. M. Rilke's poetry to offer an ever widening and circular sound.

fields.long_desc: The Latin language lends itself to echoes - with many words ending in the same syllables, it's easy to mimic the decay of an echo while changing the meaning of the word. Amore, more, ore, re: probatur amicitiae - Love, morals, words, acts: these prove friendship. This choral piece by Matthew Scott displays the echo in a six part choir above a relentlessly minimal piano accompaniment. The combination of similar, repeating parts with voice independence leaves the hear hanging on to every word the choir sings.
fields.name: Probatare Amicitiae
fields.short_desc: Based on a Latin echo, this simple choir piece uses both fugal and minimalist ideas.

fields.long_desc:
Using the Latin text 'De Profundis', "From out of the depth I cry to you, O Lord", this antiphonal piece for double choir uses rich harmonies and a double choir to show the depth of emotion involved in the prayer.  Also appropriate as concert repertoire, this advanced choral piece will be an excellent addition to any concert or service.

This piece is also available for double men's choir.
fields.name: Antiphon - De Profundis
fields.short_desc: An antiphonal setting of the Latin 'De Profundis' for double mixed choir.

fields.long_desc:
Using the Latin text 'De Profundis', "From out of the depth I cry to you, O Lord", this antiphonal piece for double choir uses rich harmonies and a double choir to show the depth of emotion involved in the prayer. Also appropriate as concert repertoire, this advanced choral piece will be an excellent addition to any concert or service.

This piece is also available for double mixed choir.
fields.name: Antiphon - De Profundis
fields.short_desc: An antiphonal setting of the Latin 'De Profundis' for double mixed choir.

fields.long_desc: Tempest (2' 30") - Beginning with a simple and unrelenting sequence of eighth-notes, this piece follows the development of a storm from first rain drop to bombastic thunder to the final downpour. Hot Water (2' 45") - This short, jazzy piano recitative was written while waiting on the hot water heater. While not exactly indicative of the mood of waiting for hot water, it does provide a comfortable few minutes of music! Mirrors (3' 20") - This piece takes a cue from its title and runs with it. Miirrored from the structure of the piece down to the core motive, and in more ways than one, this work toys with tonality while taking its process to an extreme. Character Dances (6' 15") - A collection of five miniatures describing, as the composer puts it, "people in my life." What originally began as a diary of failed relationships turned into an album of images describing personal interactions.
fields.name: Early Piano Works
fields.short_desc: Four works for piano from Matthew Scott's early compositions

fields.long_desc: Skillfully blending the beautiful carol by Adolphe Adam with the quiet devotion of Franz Schubert's Ave Maria, Matthew Blaisse brings to us a beautiful occasional song for soprano or tenor, piano, and organ - a truly one-of-a-kind arrangement.  In company with the perpetual motion of the piano and the organ's symphonic colors, the vocalist is free to proclaim the good news of Christ's birth as they drive the piece to a dramatic and resounding finish.
fields.name: O Holy Night
fields.short_desc: This beautiful arrangement combines the eponymous carol with Schubert's Ave Maria.

fields.long_desc: Winner of the 2001 National Composition Prize in Bogotá, Columbia, with an honorable mention in the 2006 Fauxharmonic Orchestra International Orchestra Composition Contest, Passacaglia showcases Federico Garcia's skills as both a composer and orchestrator. The piece delicately explores Bach's theme through Garcia's luscious use of instrumentation and knowledge of sound. (Instrumentation note: strings min. 8.8.6.6.4; 1 B-flat bass clarinet) Audio Sample Score Sample Requires Adobe Reader:
fields.name: Passacaglia on a Theme by Bach (Score + Parts)
fields.tags: 2001, award winning, adagio, audio sample, score sample
fields.short_desc: This passacaglia on a theme by Bach is an award-winning composition for orchestra.

fields.long_desc: Canon was composed in Pittsburgh between October and November of 2002, at the request of Roger Zahab (to whom it is dedicated). He and the composer premiered it at the Music on the Edge concert of November 12. Although the piece starts by assembling several motives into a recognizable 'theme', its development soon consumes itself, giving way to a less referential section where the atmosphere is set by the ethereal quality of the violin's harmonics, flautando, and sul ponticello, and the piano's clusters and pizzicato. A wonderful new addition to the violin repertoire Audio Sample Score Sample Requires Adobe Reader:
fields.name: Canon
fields.tags: extended technique, audio sample, score sample, 2002, senza misura
fields.short_desc: Commissioned by Roger Zahab, Canon for violin and piano showcases both instruments' ethereal extended techniques.
